solution_line_template: Conor can chop {eggplants_per_day} x {work_days_per_week} = <<{eggplants_per_day}*{work_days_per_week}={eggplants_per_week}>>{eggplants_per_week} eggplants a week.
He can chop {carrots_per_day} x {work_days_per_week} = <<{carrots_per_day}*{work_days_per_week}={carrots_per_week}>>{carrots_per_week} carrots a week.
He can chop {potatoes_per_day} x {work_days_per_week} = <<{potatoes_per_day}*{work_days_per_week}={potatoes_per_week}>>{potatoes_per_week} potatoes a week.

Therefore, Conor can chop {eggplants_per_week} + {carrots_per_week} + {potatoes_per_week} = <<{eggplants_per_week}+{carrots_per_week}+{potatoes_per_week}={total_vegetables_per_week}>>{total_vegetables_per_week} vegetables a week.
